subproject.description:
Indonesian Partnership Fund/IPF - component 1 : National AIDS Commission/NAC Strengthening
(1) Policy environment to support the national response improved through mainstreaming HIV into regional development plans and sector plans at national and sub-national levels
(2) Sustainability of the national response improved through increases in (i) national budgetary resources allocated for HIV activities; (ii) provincial budgetary resources allocated for HIV activities; and (iii) district budgetary resources allocated for HIV activities
(3) Coordination of the national response is strengthened with international development partners through harmonisation and alignment within the National Action Plan and through the National AIDS Commission
(4) National Monitoring and Evaluation Framework strengthened at the national and at sub-national levels and with partners reporting using nationally agreed core indicators
subproject.gender code: Gender Equality as a principal objective
subproject.title: Strengthen Nat AIDS Commission

subproject.description:
Indonesian Partnership Fund for HIV/AIDS-2nd phase (Grants Programme)
(1) Level and quality of partners’ participation, particularly that of civil society organisations involved in the response, are strengthened
(2) IPF Funds are used to address gaps in priority areas of the National Action Plan 
(3) Progress made towards achieving targets of the National Action Plan in the priority areas endorsed for Component 3-Grants Programme  funding to CSOs
subproject.gender code: Gender Equality as a principal objective
subproject.title: Grants Programme-component 3

subproject.description: IPF Transition Phase under AusAID (AUD 1 M) and USAID (USD 1 M) for component of NAC strengthening (Act-1), Rapid Response (Act-2), and Grant Disbursement (Act-3)
subproject.title: IPF Transition Phase
